infobox.Japanese title:: 失われたお宝ミステリー  (Ushinawareta Otakara Misuterī)
infobox.Animation director:: Asuka Tsubuki  Ayaka Shimoji  Nanako Ninomiya  Mako Mochida  FALCO Suzuki  Yui Ushinohama  Kana Aoki  Mina Otaka  Marie Nagano  Miho Tanaka  Yasuichiro Yamamoto
infobox.Character design:: Masatomo Sudo  Rei Masunaga (sub-character)  Hiroshi Ogawa (design works)
infobox.Voice Cast::
Voice Cast:



Minami Takayama as Conan Edogawa  Naoko Matsui as Sonoko Suzuki  Masakazu Ito as Kenzo Ukishima  Misaki Kuno as Tomoko Natsume  Asami Tano as Miyuki Tachibana  Toshiki Masuda as Katsuyuki Adachi  Kengo Tsujii as Munetake Sawada  Takayuki Miyamoto as Mover A  Fumitake Ishiguro as Mover B

sections.Situation:
Sonoko visits Kenzo Ukishima's house today, whom she will come to ask to make a catalogue for the potteries that Jirokichi Suzuki had bought a few days ago, with Conan following her because Ran has gone shopping and he has nothing else to do. At that time, Ukishima, who is holding the bandaged cat, invites the two into the house, Sonoko also brings the gift that Jirokichi has given him as a greeting.
We learn that today is the day that Ukishima moved his things to prepare for the reorganization of his work due to health issues, with some of the items not being wrapped because a collector named Munetake Sawada had bought them. However, while Ukishima opens the window, the cat almost causes some of the pottery to shatter, luckily Conan and Sonoko react in time. But the truth is that a pottery vase had been broken before the two of them arrived here.
Sawada suddenly arrives at this time, and after seeing the broken vase, he becomes extremely angry and threatens to sue Ukishima and almost causes a fight, fortunately Conan uses the stun-gun wristwatch on him to ease the tension. Everyone continues to discuss the vase issue, even using security footage to increase the persuasiveness, from which Conan is able to clearly understand the truth of the matter.

sections.Trivia: - According to production script posted by Nobuharu Kamanaka, the episode has a tentative title of Who Broke the Vase? (壺を割ったのはだれ？ ,Tsubo o watta no wa dare??)[1].
